heading: Welcome to ShiNyP
text:
work, primarily authored Yen-Hsiang Huang Department
Agronomy, National Chung Hsing University, Taiwan, licensed 
GNU General
Public License.
inquiries, please email us :
teddyhuangyh@gmail.com.Last Updated: February 2025This user guide site ShiNyP,
live https://teddyenn.github.io/ShiNyP-guide/.

heading: ShiNyP
text:
ShiNyP platform designed 
real-time processing, analysis, visualization SNP datasets.📄 Input: Genome-wide biallelic SNP Variant Call Format (VCF) file format.
📊 Analysis: Data QC, population genetics analysis, core collection, .
📋 Output: Publication-ready figures, tables, data objects, AI-driven report.Demo Datasets:
https://github.com/TeddYenn/ShiNyP/tree/main/tools/Demo_DatasetsDemo Datasets:
https://github.com/TeddYenn/ShiNyP/tree/main/tools/Demo_DatasetsShiNyP Outputs:
https://zenodo.org/records/14813628ShiNyP Outputs:
https://zenodo.org/records/14813628If encounter issues suggestions new features, please
submit report  Feedback
Form email us
: teddyhuangyh@gmail.com

heading: Installing ShiNyP
text:
Step 1: Pre-install Required PackageStep 2: Install ShiNyP Package
GitHubStep 3: Start ShiNyP PlatformStep 4: Run ShiNyP AnalysisInput SNP data VCF format, feel free use Demo
Data.Note: run RStudio, can click 
Open Browser button.
code:
install.packages("BiocManager")
BiocManager::install(version = "3.19")
BiocManager::install(c("qvalue", "SNPRelate", "ggtree"), force = TRUE)
install.packages("remotes") 
remotes::install_github("TeddYenn/ShiNyP", force = TRUE)
library(ShiNyP)
ShiNyP::run_ShiNyP()

heading: Main Functions
text:
▲ overview ShiNyP platform’s workflow genome-wide SNP data analysis.- Data Input & Processing: Beginning VCF data input, performs quality control (QC) data transformation steps.- Analysis & Output: analysis phase divided modules, represented page platform, multiple subpages offering specific analytical functions, including population structure, genetic diversity, selection sweep, core collection.- Customized Output: final output offers tailored visualizations includes AI-generated report summarizing results. pipeline streamlines data input, processing, advanced analysis deliver publication-ready figures reports customized user’s needs.
*Subpage frame colors indicate available functions customization. example, blue frames PCA DAPC correspond Scatter Plot Plus tool customizing scatter plots, red purple frames correspond Tree Plot Plus Manhattan Plot Plus, respectively.

heading: Updates
text:
Aug 2024: Initial release alpha version 
GitHub.Oct 2024: Release v0.1.0 
GitHub.Feb 2025: Upgrade update user guide.

heading: 1 Data Input
text:
➡️ section contains two subpages: VCF 
data.frame/genind/genlight, allowing upload
various data types analysis.

heading: Required Dataset (one of the following):
text:
VCF file 
PLINKVCF file 
PLINKVCF gzipped VCF (vcf.gz) file 
VCFtoolsVCF gzipped VCF (vcf.gz) file 
VCFtoolsVCF file RDS format ShiNyPVCF file RDS format ShiNyPThe VCF file contain chromosome position information 
first two columns (#CHROM 
POS), along sample names 
genotypic information. whole genome sequencing (WGS) data,
SNP marker ID information missing,
ShiNyP auto-generate SNP ID
names #CHROM:POS, 2:12500,
indicating chromosome 2, position 12500.current version (v0.1.0),
ShiNyP optimized genome-wide
SNP analysis diploid species, supporting wide range 
diploid taxa, including plants, animals, microbial eukaryotes. 
polyploid datasets, please follow steps:Step 1: Prepare Input GVCFsEnsure multiple GVCF files generated 
HaplotypeCaller sample.Step 2: Combine GVCFs (multiple samples)one sample, merge GVCFs using:Step 3: Perform Joint GenotypingRun GenotypeGVCFs generate diploid VCF:final VCF file contains diploid genotypes (0/0, 0/1, 
1/1). information, please
visit https://gatk.broadinstitute.org/hc/en-us/articles/360037057852-GenotypeGVCFs.
code:
gatk CombineGVCFs \
  -R reference.fasta \
  --variant sample1.g.vcf.gz \
  --variant sample2.g.vcf.gz \
  -O combined.g.vcf.gzgatk GenotypeGVCFs \
  -R reference.fasta \
  -V combined.g.vcf.gz \
  -O sample_diploid.vcf.gz

heading: Step 1: Get Summary
text:
First, obtain SNP summary statistics [missing rate, minor allele
frequency (MAF), heterozygosity rate, Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium
(HWE)] clicking 
Summary buttons
see results.

heading: Step 2: Sample QC
text:
Adjust thresholds click SNP QC 
Thresholds button.
generate Post-QC
data.frame file.Note: prefer perform QC based SNP missing rate 
heterozygosity rate, set missing rate threshold 1, MAF 
0, heterozygosity rate 0 1. Additionally, leave ‘
SNP QC HWE’ checkbox unticked skip QC based SNP HWE.

densities, grey indicating regions zero

chromosome. bp_over_SNPs: total base pairs (bp) per SNP 
window, representing average spacing SNPs.

providing normalized measure SNP density across genome.SNP Density (CSV): table detailing SNP density across

heading: 4 Population Structure
text:
➡️ section contains seven subpages: PCA,
DAPC, UPGMA Tree, NJ
Tree, Kinship, Scatter
PlotPlus, Tree PlotPlus
allowing conduct various population structure analyses 
customize plot.

heading: 4.1 PCA (Principal Component Analysis)
text:
widely used method uncover underlying population structure 
reducing dimensionality genetic data.

heading: Required Dataset:
text: data.frame

heading: One Step:

Click Run
PCA button 
generate PCA plots following downloadable files.Note: can upload Group Info. (Population
Structure/DAPC) Core Sample Info.
(Core Collection/Core Sample Set) 
classify individuals color PCA Scatter Plot.

heading: 4.2 DAPC (Discriminant Analysis of Principal Components)
text:
multivariate method identifying visualizing genetic clusters
combining PCA Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) (Jombart, Devillard, Balloux 2010).
information, visit
https://adegenet.r-forge.r-project.org/files/tutorial-dapc.pdf.

heading: Required Dataset:
text: genind

heading: Step 1: Cluster Identification
text:
Click Run DAPC
button 
determine optimal number clusters (lowest BIC value
indicates optimal number clusters).Note: default number PC axes cluster identification 
set retain PCs capture 80% total variance. 
can refer “PC Explained Variance Plot” Population
Structure/PCA subpage.

heading: 4.3 UPGMA (Unweighted Pair Group Method with Arithmetic mean) Tree
text:
classic approaach constructing rooted trees based genetic
distance data. UPGMA tree generated poppr ggtree packages
(Yu et al. 2016; Kamvar, Tabima, Grünwald 2014).

heading: Required Dataset:
text: genlight

heading: Steps:
text:
Choose number bootstrap replicates, used 
assessing confidence branching structure.Choose number bootstrap replicates, used 
assessing confidence branching structure.Click Run
UPGMA button 
generate tree plot.Click Run
UPGMA button 
generate tree plot.Note: can download “UPGMA Object” upload 
Population Structure/Tree PlotPlus
subpage customize phylogenetic tree.

heading: Outputs:
text:
UPGMA Phylogenetic Tree (PDF): UPGMA rooted tree 
user-defined layout style.UPGMA Phylogenetic Tree (PDF): UPGMA rooted tree 
user-defined layout style.UPGMA Object (RDS): Contains information UPGMA tree,
can used input data Population
Structure/Tree PlotPlus subpage.UPGMA Object (RDS): Contains information UPGMA tree,
can used input data Population
Structure/Tree PlotPlus subpage.UPGMA Tree Complete!

heading: 4.4 NJ (Neighbor-Joining) Tree
text:
method building unrooted trees using genetic distance data. NJ
tree generated ape ggtree packages (Paradis Schliep 2018; Yu et al. 2016).

heading: Required Dataset:
text: genlight

heading: One Step:
text:
Click Run
NJ button 
generate tree plot.Note: can download “NJ Object” upload 
Population Structure/Tree PlotPlus
subpage customize phylogenetic tree.

user-defined layout style.NJ Phylogenetic Tree (PDF): NJ unrooted tree 
user-defined layout style.NJ Object (RDS): Contains information NJ tree, 
can used input data Population
Structure/Tree PlotPlus subpage.NJ Object (RDS): Contains information NJ tree, 
can used input data Population
Structure/Tree PlotPlus subpage.NJ Tree Complete!

heading: 4.5 Kinship Analysis
text:
statistical method assessing genetic relationships relatedness
among individuals based shared alleles (Kang et al. 2010). Kinship matrix 
generated statgenGWAS package.information, visit
https://rdrr.io/cran/statgenGWAS/man/kinship.html.

heading: Required Dataset:
text: data.frame

heading: Steps:
text:
Upload Group Info. 
Population Structure/DAPC (optional). 
uploaded, order samples follow group assignment;
otherwise, follow order original VCF data.Upload Group Info. 
Population Structure/DAPC (optional). 
uploaded, order samples follow group assignment;
otherwise, follow order original VCF data.Choose method run kinship analysis.Choose method run kinship analysis.Click Run
Kinship button 
generate kinship matrix.Click Run
Kinship button 
generate kinship matrix.

heading: Outputs:
text:
Kinship Matrix Plot (PDF): visual representation 
kinship matrix.Kinship Matrix Plot (PDF): visual representation 
kinship matrix.Kinship Matrix (RDS): Contains kinship matrix data.Kinship Matrix (RDS): Contains kinship matrix data.Note: kinship matrix can directly used input GAPIT
package genome-wide association studies (GWAS), helping control

heading: 5.4 AMOVA (Analysis of MOlecular VAriance)
text:
method assessing genetic variations relationships within 
populations (Excoffier, Smouse, Quattro 1992).approach performed using
function hierfstat poppr packages (Kamvar, Tabima, Grünwald 2014; GOUDET 2004).

heading: Required Dataset:
text:
genind ‘Group Info.’,
downloadable Data Conversion page 
data.frame Group Info.

heading: Step 1: Run AMOVA
text:
Click Run
AMOVA button 
partition genetic variation among within populations.

heading: Step 2: Run Permutation Test
text:
Choose number randomizations permutation test 
detect significance three hierarchical levels. recommend
using 9, 99 (default), 199, 499, 799, 999 permutations 
classical p-values.Choose number randomizations permutation test 
detect significance three hierarchical levels. recommend
using 9, 99 (default), 199, 499, 799, 999 permutations 
classical p-values.Click Run Permutation
Test button 
perform statistical test.Click Run Permutation
Test button 
perform statistical test.

AMOVA Variance Plot (PDF): pie chart showing explained
genetic variance population strata among defined groups.AMOVA Variance Plot (PDF): pie chart showing explained
genetic variance population strata among defined groups.AMOVA Variance Test (PDF): plot showing significance test
population strata among defined groups. histograms depict
randomized strata distributions, black line representing
genetic variance components.AMOVA Variance Test (PDF): plot showing significance test
population strata among defined groups. histograms depict
randomized strata distributions, black line representing
genetic variance components.AMOVA Table (CSV): table detailed AMOVA results.AMOVA Table (CSV): table detailed AMOVA results.AMOVA Complete!

heading: ❌ Encountered an error? Let’s fix it!
text:
⚠️ Error: find function OpenAI
error may indicate irudnyts/openai package 
GitHub installed correctly. resolve issue, try
reinstalling package using following command:

detach("package:ShiNyP", unload = TRUE)
detach("package:openai", unload = TRUE)
remotes::install_github("irudnyts/openai", ref = "r6", force = TRUE)
library(openai)
# Start ShiNyP Platform 
library(ShiNyP)
ShiNyP::run_ShiNyP()
error may indicate irudnyts/openai package 
GitHub installed correctly. resolve issue, try
reinstalling package using following command:⚠️ Error: HTTP 401 Unauthorized
error message indicates authentication credentials
invalid. happen several reasons, :
using revoked API key.
using different API key one requesting
organization.
using API key required
permissions endpoint calling.
resolve error, first check using correct
API key organization ID request header. can find
API key organization ID account settings
.
error message indicates authentication credentials
invalid. happen several reasons, :using revoked API key.using revoked API key.using different API key one requesting
organization.using different API key one requesting
organization.using API key required
permissions endpoint calling.using API key required
permissions endpoint calling.resolve error, first check using correct
API key organization ID request header. can find
API key organization ID account settings
.⚠️ Error: Failed Perform HTTP Request
error may indicate request timed , possibly due 
excessive input token count, prevents OpenAI model 
completing task within allotted time.
resolve issue, try selecting ‘GPT-3.5 Turbo’ model 
generate report first. successful, can switch 
models subsequent tasks.
error may indicate request timed , possibly due 
excessive input token count, prevents OpenAI model 
completing task within allotted time.resolve issue, try selecting ‘GPT-3.5 Turbo’ model 
generate report first. successful, can switch 
models subsequent tasks.AI Report Complete!
code:
detach("package:ShiNyP", unload = TRUE)
detach("package:openai", unload = TRUE)
remotes::install_github("irudnyts/openai", ref = "r6", force = TRUE)
library(openai)
# Start the ShiNyP Platform Again
library(ShiNyP)
ShiNyP::run_ShiNyP()
